metadata.Title: CVE-2018-11529 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
VideoLAN VLC media player 2.2.x is prone to a use after free vulnerabilitywhich an attacker can leverage to execute arbitrary code via crafted MKVfiles. Failed exploit attempts will likely result in denial of serviceconditions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-11529` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvlc-bin - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
libvlc5 - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
libvlccore9 - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
vlc - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
vlc-bin - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
vlc-data - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
vlc-l10n - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
vlc-plugin-access-extra - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
vlc-plugin-base - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
vlc-plugin-fluidsynth - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
vlc-plugin-jack - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
vlc-plugin-notify - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
vlc-plugin-qt - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
vlc-plugin-samba - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
vlc-plugin-skins2 - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
vlc-plugin-svg - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
vlc-plugin-video-output - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
vlc-plugin-video-splitter - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
vlc-plugin-visualization - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: vlc package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1').
